derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Italian semolino, diminutive of semola 'bran', from Latin simila 'flour'

entry.tran: (用于做布丁或意大利面食的)粗面粉
entry.def: Semolina consists of small hard grains of wheat that are used for making sweet puddings with milk and for making pasta.

means.word_mean: 1. milled product of durum wheat (or other hard wheat) used in pasta
